Administrative and Budgetary Questions; 
 
3. 
In addition to the appropriations approved under paragraph 1 above, an 
amount of 75,000 dollars is appropriated for 2022 from the accumulated income of 
the Library Endowment Fund for the purchase of books, periodicals, maps and library 
equipment and for such other expenses of the Library at the Palais des Nations in 
Geneva as are in accordance with the objects and provisions of the endowment.

2.

3. 
Direct expenses of the United Nations Postal Administration, services to 
visitors, the sale of statistical products, catering operations and related services, 
garage operations, television services and the sale of publications not provided for 
under the budget appropriations shall be charged against the income derived from 
those activities. 
 
54th (resumed) plenary meeting 
24 December 2021 
 
 
C 
Financing of appropriations for the year 2022 
 
 
The General Assembly 
 
Resolves that, for 2022: 
 
1. 
Budget appropriations totalling 3,138,294,955 United States dollars, 
consisting of 3,121,651,000 dollars approved for 2022 by the General Assembly in 
paragraph 1 of resolution A above, and 16,643,955 dollars in additional 
appropriations for 2021, as approved by the Assembly in its resolutions 75/253 B of 
16 April 2021 and 75/253 C of 30 June 2021, shall be financed in accordance with 
regulations 3.1 and 3.2 of the Financial Regulations and Rules of the United Nations, 1 
as follows:  
 
(a) 
16,361,600 dollars, representing the estimated income other than staff 
assessment income approved for 2022 under resolution B above; 
 
(b) 
77,094,200 dollars, as reflected in the financial performance report on the 
programme budget for 2020,2 approved by the Assembly in section I of its resolution 
76/246 of 24 December 2021; 
 
(c) 
580,100 dollars credited from the unencumbered balance of the 
Extraordinary Chambers in the Courts of Cambodia in 2020, as approved in 
section XII of Assembly resolution 76/246; 
 
(d) 
3,044,259,055 dollars, representing the assessment on Member States in 
accordance with Assembly resolution 76/238 of 24 December 2021 on the scale of 
assessments for the apportionment of the expenses of the United Nations; 
 
2. 
In addition, there shall be added an amount of 107,636,800 dollars, 
representing the commitment authority relating to special political missions approved

paragraphs.1: Budget appropriations totalling 3,138,294,955 United States dollars, consisting of 3,121,651,000 dollars approved for 2022 by the General Assembly in paragraph 1 of resolution A above, and 16,643,955 dollars in additional appropriations for 2021, as approved by the Assembly in its resolutions 75/253 B of 16 April 2021 and 75/253 C of 30 June 2021, shall be financed in accordance with regulations 3.1 and 3.2 of the Financial Regulations and Rules of the United Nations, 1 as follows: (a) 16,361,600 dollars, representing the estimated income other than staff assessment income approved for 2022 under resolution B above; (b) 77,094,200 dollars, as reflected in the financial performance report on the programme budget for 2020,2 approved by the Assembly in section I of its resolution 76/246 of 24 December 2021; (c) 580,100 dollars credited from the unencumbered balance of the Extraordinary Chambers in the Courts of Cambodia in 2020, as approved in section XII of Assembly resolution 76/246; (d) 3,044,259,055 dollars, representing the assessment on Member States in accordance with Assembly resolution 76/238 of 24 December 2021 on the scale of assessments for the apportionment of the expenses of the United Nations;
paragraphs.2: In addition, there shall be added an amount of 107,636,800 dollars, representing the commitment authority relating to special political missions approved by the General Assembly in section X of its resolution 76/246, resulting in a total amount to be assessed of 3,151,895,855 dollars;
paragraphs.3: There shall be set off against the assessment on Member States, in accordance with the provisions of General Assembly resolution 973 (X) of 15 December 1955, their respective share in the Tax Equalization Fund totalling 279,225,500 dollars, consisting of 279,138,300 dollars related to the appropriations for 2022 and 87,200 dollars related to the additional appropriations for 2021, as approved by the Assembly in its resolutions 75/253 B and 75/253 C.
